page.title: 01Part of The Alde Valley
page.content: This area is predominantly arable, cereal crops are grown on the higher ground.In this part of the Alde valley the River Alde runs right through the block. Low hills rise from flat river meadows which are grazed in summer. There are many mature oak trees in the valley and in places old hedges still exist from mediaeval times.Small areas of woodland are common; mainly deciduous except conifers where planted for timber. Most farmhouses and cottages with the exception of small numbers of modern bungalows and council houses, are of traditional Suffolk construction. Timber frame with plaster rendering and pantiled roofs. Agriculture is the main occupation. The three villages of Bruisyard Cransford and Rendham contain a good proportion of elderly and retired residents
